pull.title: cmake: Introduce translate.cmake script for translate target
pull.body:
Using `file(GLOB)` in the generates step is discouraged because the globbing result may be out of date when the target is built. Performing the globbing in a script that is executed as the build target means the result is always reproducable and the overhead of globbing is only paid when used.

As a follow up, the dependency on `sed` may be removed by performing the replacement with cmake. Also, the logic from extract_strings_qt.py can be migrated to cmake.

* [#33156](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33156) (cmake: Do not require Python to build GUI by hebasto)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
<!--5faf32d7da4f0f540f40219e4f7537a3-->

ACK ee2c5bc81c64d68057278f951c37c8b52e21ff92, I have reviewed the code and tested it on Ubuntu 24.04. The output files match those in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33194.

This PR effectively fixes the same issue as https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33194 and is superior to it.

verification.payload:
tree 6f91a70b7c3ddb8c20c1515f4d3d4aed26f1473c
parent 57e8f34fe20620b3350ca1f0fa5c7d8d3a06be82
author Daniel Pfeifer <daniel@pfeifer-mail.de> 1755260968 +0100
committer Daniel Pfeifer <daniel@pfeifer-mail.de> 1755500608 +0200

cmake: Introduce translate.cmake script for translate target

Using `file(GLOB)` in the generates step is discouraged because the
globbing result may be out of date when the target is built.
Performing the globbing in a script that is executed as the build
target means the result is always reproducable and the overhead
of globbing is only paid when used.

As a follow up, the dependency on `sed` may be removed by performing
the replacement with cmake. Also, the logic from extract_strings_qt.py
can be migrated to cmake.

Performing the globbing in a script that is executed as the build
target means the result is always reproducable and the overhead
of globbing is only paid when used.

As a follow up, the dependency on `sed` may be removed by performing
the replacement with cmake. Also, the logic from extract_strings_qt.py
can be migrated to cmake.

comments.body: nit: Why this year range? This script seems like brand-new code to me.

+  XGETTEXT_EXECUTABLE

comments.body:
style-nit: Everywhere else, closing parentheses are aligned with the beginning of the command: 
```suggestion
)
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,82 @@
+# Copyright (c) 2012-2025 The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+
+set(input_variables
+  PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR
+  COPYRIGHT_HOLDERS
+  LCONVERT_EXECUTABLE
+  LUPDATE_EXECUTABLE
+  PYTHON_EXECUTABLE
+  XGETTEXT_EXECUTABLE
+  )
+
+foreach(var IN LISTS input_variables)
+  if(NOT DEFINED ${var})
+    message(FATAL_ERROR "Variable '${var}' is not defined!")
+  endif()
+endforeach()
+
+file(GLOB_RECURSE translatable_sources
+  "${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR}/src/*.h"
+  "${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR}/src/*.cpp"
+  "${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR}/src/*.mm"
+  )
+
+file(GLOB_RECURSE qt_translatable_sources
+  "${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR}/src/qt/*.h"
+  "${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR}/src/qt/*.cpp"
+  "${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR}/src/qt/*.mm"
+  )
+
+file(GLOB ui_files
+  "${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR}/src/qt/forms/*.ui"
+  )
+
+set(subtrees crc32c crypto/ctaes leveldb minisketch secp256k1)
+set(exclude_dirs bench compat crypto support test univalue)
+foreach(directory IN LISTS subtrees exclude_dirs)
+  list(FILTER translatable_sources
+    EXCLUDE REGEX "${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR}/src/${directory}/.*"
+    )
+endforeach()
+
+set(ENV{XGETTEXT} "${XGETTEXT_EXECUTABLE}")
+set(ENV{COPYRIGHT_HOLDERS} "${COPYRIGHT_HOLDERS}")
comments.body: The scope of this environment variables could be limited to `extract_strings_qt.py` only.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,82 @@
+# Copyright (c) 2012-2025 The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+
+set(input_variables
+  PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR
+  COPYRIGHT_HOLDERS
+  LCONVERT_EXECUTABLE
+  LUPDATE_EXECUTABLE
+  PYTHON_EXECUTABLE
+  XGETTEXT_EXECUTABLE
+  )
+
+foreach(var IN LISTS input_variables)
+  if(NOT DEFINED ${var})
+    message(FATAL_ERROR "Variable '${var}' is not defined!")
+  endif()
+endforeach()
+
+file(GLOB_RECURSE translatable_sources
+  "${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR}/src/*.h"
+  "${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR}/src/*.cpp"
+  "${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR}/src/*.mm"
+  )
+
+file(GLOB_RECURSE qt_translatable_sources
+  "${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR}/src/qt/*.h"
+  "${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR}/src/qt/*.cpp"
+  "${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR}/src/qt/*.mm"
+  )
+
+file(GLOB ui_files
+  "${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR}/src/qt/forms/*.ui"
+  )
+
+set(subtrees crc32c crypto/ctaes leveldb minisketch secp256k1)
+set(exclude_dirs bench compat crypto support test univalue)
+foreach(directory IN LISTS subtrees exclude_dirs)
+  list(FILTER translatable_sources
+    EXCLUDE REGEX "${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR}/src/${directory}/.*"
+    )
+endforeach()
+
+set(ENV{XGETTEXT} "${XGETTEXT_EXECUTABLE}")
+set(ENV{COPYRIGHT_HOLDERS} "${COPYRIGHT_HOLDERS}")
+
+execute_process(COMMAND ${PYTHON_EXECUTABLE}
+    ${CMAKE_CURRENT_LIST_DIR}/extract_strings_qt.py
+    ${translatable_sources}
+  WORKING_DIRECTORY ${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR}/src
+  COMMAND_ERROR_IS_FATAL ANY
+  )
+
+execute_process(
+  COMMAND ${LUPDATE_EXECUTABLE}
+    -no-obsolete
+    -I ${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR}/src
+    -locations relative ${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR}/src/qt/bitcoinstrings.cpp
+    ${ui_files}
+    ${qt_translatable_sources}
+    -ts ${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR}/src/qt/locale/bitcoin_en.ts
+  WORKING_DIRECTORY ${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR}/src
comments.body: Is the `WORKING_DIRECTORY` option needed here and below?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,82 @@
+# Copyright (c) 2012-2025 The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+
+set(input_variables
+  PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR
+  COPYRIGHT_HOLDERS
+  LCONVERT_EXECUTABLE
+  LUPDATE_EXECUTABLE
+  PYTHON_EXECUTABLE
+  XGETTEXT_EXECUTABLE
+  )
comments.body:
Define Everywhere? Indenting the closing paren is the original CMake style!
It probably dates back to when CMake was using [Whitesmiths](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indentation_style#Whitesmiths) indentation style for the C++ codebase.
I am OK with dedenting the closing paren if that is preferred here.
